comment: Very kind and approachable! While she did move along concepts fairly quickly, she is a great professor who explains concepts clearly and in a way that is easy to understand and follow. She also posted the lecture ppt after every every class, so if you happened to miss class, you wouldn't fall behind.

I could spend hours talking about how great she was. She explained concepts well, and was great at answering peoples questions. She had office hours, and worked in the math open lab and was always willing to help. She was always so nice and even did an interview with me for a scholarship I applied to. I wish she taught my other math classes!

She is AMAZING! This course requires attendance, or you'll fail. I had surgery and missed 3 months but passed by studying on ALEKS and attending SI sessions when I returned. The ALEKS homework has many questions weekly, but you get 3 extra days for an 80. The SI tutor helped a lot, and I still got an A. It's doable, but don't slack off!

Honestly, the class materials in themselves were not that difficult or confusing but it was so difficult to pay attention in class. I mean she was nice and all,  but I never really got the impression that she cared about her students grades. Also, attendance is graded and all tests are in-person and on paper which kinda sucks.

I honestly really liked her, she was always really sweet, and explained the lectures really well. She did assign a lot of homework but I do think it helped a lot with making sure you really understood the topic. She did take attendance every class but she doesn't mind if you are a bit late.
She doesn't give you any answer choices on the test, gives 40+ questions of homework every week along with extra credit 10+ questions, and teaches very fast and attendance is mandatory every class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She made this class super easy. Had homework weekly on aleks but easy to complete. 4 major tests plus the final, allowed to use notecards on tests. Very straightforward and uses aleks practice tests for the test questions. She may go a bit fast sometimes but always willing to answer questions and explain. Highly recommend!
Great Professor and is helpful with any questions asked. Does go a little fast when teaching though but will slow down if asked!

I went to her multiple times asking to explain problems to which she told me I should have paid attention and to go get a tutor. She is not accommodating and tests are not like what we do in class. I basically had to teach myself because all she does is rush through slides barley explaining problems until the very last minute of class every day.
